Chapel Hill, North Carolina
Dear Dr. Wynn:
I AM VERY MUCH INTERESTED IN THE PROBLEMS FACING THE
NAEB Professional Advancement Committee of which you are
chairman. The goals and purposes of your committee seem to
coincide, at least partially, with the topic of a research
project that I am currently considering, l.E. a study of the
qualifications and training of personnel involved in the
PRODUCTION OF E DU C ATI ONAL PROGRAMS.
Being aware of your committee’s work and not wishing
TO DUPLICATE RESEARCH THAT HAS BEEN DONE, l HAVE WRITTEN TO
YOU IN THE HOPE THAT YOU COULD SUPPLY ME WITH CERTAIN
INFORMATION. SPECIFICALLY, I NEED TO KNOW WHAT RESEARCH HAS
BiEEN DONE UP TO THIS POINT THAT WOULD ASSIST THE COMMITTEE IN
REALIZING THE FIRST THREE GOALS STATED IN ITS OCTOBER I, 1956,
report. Those goals were:
1. The upgrading of staff and personnel of
NAEB STATIONS AND PRODUCTION CENTERS.
2. The evaluation and development of job
qualifications of personnel involved in
educational broadcasting.
3. The discovery of areas of weakness in the
standards for personnel and the develop¬
ment of recommendations for the correction
OF THESE WEAKNESSES.
Since my research is in the preliminary planning stage,
ANY SUGGESTIONS BY YOU OR ANY MEMBER OF THE COMMITTEE WOULD
BE WELCOME. IF THE DEVELOPMENT OF THIS PROJECT ALONG CERTAIN
